articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Crispian Balmer, Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The U.N. Security Council is also set to vote on a demand for a ceasefire between Israel and Palestinian militants Hamas and humanitarian access across Gaza.
articles.title: US-backed Gaza aid group to halt distribution on Wednesday, UN to vote on ceasefire demand

articles.author: Yimou Lee, Ben Blanchard
articles.description: The world will never forget China's 1989 crackdown on pro-democracy demonstrators in Tiananmen Square, Taiwan's president and the top U.S. diplomat said on the 36th anniversary of an event Beijing treats as taboo and allows no public remembrance.
articles.title: We will never forget Tiananmen crackdown, Taiwan and US say on 36th anniversary

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Wednesday marks the 36th anniversary of China's bloody crackdown on pro-democracy demonstrations in and around central Beijing's Tiananmen Square, when Chinese troops opened fire on their own people.
articles.title: China's Tiananmen Square demonstrations and crackdown

articles.author: Ju-Min Park, Hyunsu Yim
articles.description: South Korea's new President Lee Jae-myung rode a wave of voter anger against the December martial law attempt by his ousted predecessor, but his ability to lead will be judged by the strength of his policies.
articles.title: Riding wave of voter anger, South Korea's Lee now faces policy challenges

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea appears to have returned to an upright position its stricken Choe Hyun Class destroyer that partially capsized during a botched launching ceremony, U.S. researchers said on Wednesday.
articles.title: North Korea pulls capsized warship upright after botched launch, report says

articles.author: Joyce Lee, Ju-Min Park
articles.description: South Korea woke on Wednesday to a new liberal president, Lee Jae-myung, who vowed to raise the country from the turmoil of a martial law crisis and revive an economy reeling from slowing growth and the threat of global protectionism.
articles.title: South Korea's liberal new president Lee Jae-myung vows economic revival, judgement against martial law

articles.author: Alasdair Pal
articles.description: An Australian woman accused of murdering three of her estranged husband's elderly relatives with poisonous mushrooms gave her account of the fatal lunch on Wednesday, in a case that has gripped the public.
articles.title: Erin Patterson: Australian mushroom murders accused gives her account of fatal lunch

articles.author: Jasper Ward, Jeff Mason
articles.description: President Trump signed an executive proclamation that puts into effect from Wednesday his surprise announcement last week that he was taking the tariffs on steel and aluminum imports that had been in place since March to 50% from 25%.
articles.title: Higher metals tariffs kick in as deadline for 'best' offers arrives

articles.author: Lisa Barrington, Shivansh Tiwary, Joanna Plucinska
articles.description: Proliferating conflict zones are an increasing burden on airline operations and profitability, executives say, as carriers grapple with missiles and drones, airspace closures, location spoofing and the shoot-down of another passenger flight.
articles.title: Expanding missile threats and airspace closures are straining airlines

articles.author: Olena Harmash, Aleksandar Vasovic
articles.description: Senior Ukrainian officials visited Washington seeking U.S. support against Russia, as Kyiv showed its ability to fight on by setting off an explosive device under a bridge that has become a symbol of the Kremlin's claims on Ukrainian territory.
articles.title: Zelenskiy aides visit US as Ukraine strikes Russian-held territory
